src:
Gitlab больше не будут нанимать* инженеров из России и Китая
04 Nov 2019, 11:19 by MIU
WIP: Support Engineer Job family country–of–residence block (#5555) · Issues ·.com / www–gitlab–com### Edit: This is still a discussion and there is no policy confirming this yet. – — In e–group on Monday October 15, 2019 we took the decision to enable a...gitlab.com
Объяснение: некоторые корпоративные клиенты озабочены возможностью доступа к их данным русскими и китайскими сотрудниками Gitlab, ну и "это становится обычной практикой в ​​нашей отрасли в нынешних геополитических условиях".Upd.: В соседней теме раскрыли, кто же этот "клиент". Изначально хотели запретить набор* из Китая, России и Украины.Upd. 2: Gitlab имеет список стран, откуда они не нанимают людей. Кроме очевидных (Iran, North Korea, Crimea, Syria, Sudan, Cuba, United Arab Emirates) там есть довольно неожиданные: Argentina, Sweden, Nigeria, China, Spain (охуели совсем), Brazil, Italy, France.* на должности, которые дают доступ к данным пользователей.
text:
Gitlab will no longer hire * engineers from Russia and China
04 Nov 2019, 11:19 by MIU
WIP: Support Engineer Job family country – of – residence block (# 5555) · Issues · .com / www – gitlab – com ### Edit: This is still a discussion and there is no policy confirming this yet. - - In e – group on Monday October 15, 2019 we took the decision to enable a ... gitlab.com
Explanation: some corporate clients are concerned about the possibility of access to their data by Russian and Chinese Gitlab employees, well, “this is becoming a common practice in our industry in the current geopolitical conditions.” Upd .: In the next topic, they revealed who this “client” is. Initially, they wanted to ban the recruitment * of China, Russia and Ukraine.Upd. 2: Gitlab has a list of countries where they don’t hire people from. In addition to the obvious ones (Iran, North Korea, Crimea, Syria, Sudan, Cuba, United Arab Emirates) there are quite unexpected ones: Argentina, Sweden, Nigeria, China, Spain (completely fucked up), Brazil, Italy, France. * For posts that give access to user data.
